ingredients: 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut into 3/4-inch cubes
instructions: In a large nonstick skillet or wok, stir-fry cabbage in 1 teaspoon hot oil for 1-2 minutes. Add carrots; stir-fry 3-4 minutes longer or until carrots are crisp-tender. Remove and keep warm.

Stir-fry the pork in remaining oil for 2 minutes. Add ginger and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until pork is lightly browned. Stir in 3/4 cup broth and soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 3 minutes or until meat juices run clear.

Combine cornstarch and remaining broth until smooth. Gradually stir into pan. Return cabbage and carrots to skillet. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2-3 minutes or until thickened. Serve over rice if desired.
title: Oriental Pork Cabbage Stir-Fry
sentences: In a large nonstick skillet or wok, stir-fry cabbage in 1 teaspoon hot oil for 1-2 minutes.
Add carrots; stir-fry 3-4 minutes longer or until carrots are crisp-tender.
Stir-fry the pork in remaining oil for 2 minutes.
Add ginger and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until pork is lightly browned.
Stir in 3/4 cup broth and soy sauce.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 3 minutes or until meat juices run clear.
Combine cornstarch and remaining broth until smooth.
Return cabbage and carrots to skillet.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2-3 minutes or until thickened.
